title: turns two column names into one
text: SurveyMonkey provides response data contains column second row containing column-name data, requires data cleaning starting analysis.

title: turns two column names into one
text: Adopting clean_headr + trim_headr (hopefully) make workflow efficient. Quick simple approach working downloaded inherited .csv .xlsx files, many responses pull via API. (Another highly recommended solution Advantage Premier-level users pulling data via SurveyMonkey API surveymonkey package.)

title: turns two column names into one
text: package early stages development. issues welcome, please report happy troubleshoot anything comes .

title: turns two column names into one
text: clean_headr concatenates values column names first row makes sense. trim_headr trims long strings column names. flag_mins flags respondents meeting minimum duration minutes complete survey

title: turns two column names into one
turns two column names into one
text: downloaded inherited .csv/.xlsx file look something like demo included doubleheadr. worries though! Cleaning column names easy 1,2… ’s ! Two steps. Start unhelpful column names:
code: colnames(doubleheadr::demo) ##  [1] "Respondent ID"                                 ##  [2] "Please provide your contact information:"      ##  [3] "...3"                                          ##  [4] "...4"                                          ##  [5] "...5"                                          ##  [6] "...6"                                          ##  [7] "...7"                                          ##  [8] "...8"                                          ##  [9] "...9"                                          ## [10] "...10"                                         ## [11] "...11"                                         ## [12] "I wish it would have snowed more this winter."

title: flag_mins — flag_mins
text: Flag survey duration based many minutes respondent took. assumption data.frame contains two columns: "date_created" "date_modified".

title: flag_mins — flag_mins
text: dat data.frame containing SurveyMonkey response data, two columns "date_created" "date_modified". mins whole number specifying cutoff .

title: flag_mins — flag_mins
text: data.frame object.

title: flag_text — flag_text
text: Scan row elements character vector create boolean column flag_text element present. use case scan survey data PID first/last names, scan free-text survey responses foul language non-alphanumeric values, etc.

text: dat data.frame. text_vector character vector values identify data.frame. ignore_columns character vector column names ignored flagging rows.

title: trim_headr — trim_headr
text: Trim column names removing string matches partial string matches. Supply character string values character vector, matches removed column names. instance, supplying c('foo', 'bar') remove instances 'foo' /'bar' present column names.
